newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Two die in explosion in Russian police station.
newsitem.headline: Two die in explosion in Russian police station.

text.p: Two policemen were killed and 11 were injured when a powerful explosion rocked a police station in the autonomous republic of Tatarstan, leaving a gaping hole in the centre of the building, local police said on Monday.

A spokesman said the blast occurred on Friday at a building housing police and security guards in the town of Almetyevsk some 1,000 km (600 miles) east of Moscow. An investigation was under way, but it was too early to say what caused the blast.
"Investigators are considering a number of options as to what caused the blast", the spokesman said. He said the building was not linked to the gas mains.
Television pictures showed a badly damaged building with a blackened hole in the middle.
